reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A wonderfully written historical fiction novel
reviews.reviewText: I am so glad that I read this novel. It’s a heart wrenching look at the Siege of Leningrad, which I admit I knew little to nothing about. The research and care in the storytelling made it a page-turner for me. As a matter of fact I stayed up all of last night reading and waiting to solve the mystery of Vera. I started the book by listening on Audible but finished by reading it on Kindle. This gave me time to digest everything that I had just read. On reading the author’s notes at the end I realized that Kristin Hannah spent so much time and care telling this story and I am so glad she did. The character development for the main three women was well developed. I suggest reading the author’s notes as to why she ended the book as she did. I also appreciated the recipes included in the afterward. Thank you for this novel, Ms. Hannah. It will stay with me for a long time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This book was devastingly beautiful
reviews.reviewText: I can’t remember being so moved by a book. This story, the characters and the history that connects it all is just so well done.The thought, care and time put into developing every detail — details so minor, yet so significant later in the book. The heartbreak Anya surprises for a lifetime, finally heals in such a profound and wonderful way. Thanks to a promise, her daughters were able to Anya bridge the past with the present, while creating hope for the future.It’s hit all the marks for me: grief, regret, self-reflection, love, hope, family, growth and healing. What a truly amazing story — one that I will think about often.Wonderful. JUST wonderful.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Couldn’t decide between 4 or 5 stars
reviews.reviewText: This book… i partially read and partially listened to it. listening to it being read with Russian accent was something especially enjoyable. I love historical fictions. Especially in World War II. this is probably my third historical fiction with the protagonist viewpoint from a Russian side. it is so easy to sympathize with those in England, Poland, Italy, America during World War III, but rarely do we see anything regarding Russia.My eyes have been open to a whole different side. truthfully, I was very much annoyed with Meredith and I couldn’t understand Anya. Anya, was very much a cold, stereotypical Russian woman. But I loved how the stories unfolded between Anya and Meredith and even Nina. The story gets better near the end. my heart broke my eyes teared up and yet I had a slight bit of joy at the end. Was this my favorite book ever? No. I truly wish there was more of a happy ending. But i am so glad i read this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars LIFE JOY PAIN LOVE and FORGIVENESS
reviews.reviewText: This book has me thinking about my life in so many ways. I loved everything about this book. I can say that it will be one of the best I have ever read. I felt the love the pain the joy and when forgiveness takes over and heals. We don’t know what we are capable of doing until we go through the path that our God gives.. please read this and find forgiveness in your on life…

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Life's Challenges and Rewards
reviews.reviewText: I loved the way the Fairy Tale told the story of their Mother and how she became who she had been their entire life and How the telling of the Tale Healed her and brought her to her 1st Daughter. Then how they had 10 years all together; Daughters, SOs, Grand Children....then she died peacefully in her garden. Then it also seemed to heal the daughters by giving them a balance of life and Happiness.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One of the best books I've read in a very long time!
reviews.reviewText: This is the second book I've read by Kristin Hannah. I now have a new favorite author! I would highly recommend this book. It was very hard for me to put it down. Her writing makes you feel like you are living in the time period yourself! I couldn't wait for tomorrow to come so I could pick up where I left off. It is a must read. You will NOT be disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good story, well written
reviews.reviewText: Another compelling book by Kristin Hannah. I had difficulty putting it down. I am always reluctant to read a "dual timeline" story since so few authors do it well, but Kristin Hannah excels at this style. She keeps her characters at a minimum and her timeframes a reasonable number of decades apart so the story is nicely and believably tied up at the end.While I wasn't enamored with the current-day daughters; their emotionally vacant upbringing was believable enough to explain their personalities. The mom's story was heart breakingly told thanks to all the research the author did on the atrocities during the Siege of Leningrad and the decade earlier Great Purge under Stalin's leadership. I appreciated the uplifting ending.I did read some of the reviews and was saddened at the number of people who know nothing about this period in world history. Not just the atrocities of WWII, but the devastating effects of Stalinism in Russia the decades prior. Hopefully this book will encourage readers to learn more.

reviews.reviewerName: a very enjoyable bookgood enough to put everything down and read in one day!
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The first word that came to mind .......but also family, love, pain endurance. History ..... Learned about total brutality in Russia under Stalin , learned about the strength of people and love. A full book. A good read!!!!!
Loved the book am taking it to a friend of mine she will like it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Fabulous story telling. Felt i was there in every moment. Wonderfully descriptive. Well researched and well written Kristin Hannah. Thank you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on October 14, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Erg jammer dat ik een boek bestel met de hoop die kaft binnen te krijgen en dat er dan een andere paperback kaft binnen komt.. Ik raad aan om die foto dan ook weg te halen (kaft met oranje/blauwe kleuren)
Love historical fiction and books like this that empower women.
aAvery touching ánd beautifully written novel.
